page.title: 07Hubberdale Farm - Flagg
page.content: Mr.Jack Howe who has lived at the farm for all his seventy four years and as a boy walked over the fields to Taddington School,related how up to thirty years ago-before the advent of mains water-carts went into Flagg village to collect water drawn up from a mineshaft.Outside the farmhouse is a spoilheap from the Hubberdale Leadmine now only a fraction of its former size since a former owner had to use most of the heap-then as high as the two storey farmhouse-to fill in the collapsed farmyard which one night fell into the underground mine workings! His younger partner recently drove a gatepost through the ground into the sough which comes out at Deepdale,Taddington.The mine itself is grassed over and apart from the capped shafts there is little evidence of its former frenzied activity.
